content.description: SDS real bunchy at the bottom of the arete with a small left foot chip and crimps on either side of the arete.  Make a huge move up and left on the face.  Bear down and pull your way into a good two finger edge 8' up on the arete.  From here climb up overhanging ledges to gain a spooky but chill mantle.  Reach over the upper headwall to find a sinker slot jug!  Classic!!!
Start low and left of the arete at the bottom of a V shaped ledge.  traverse to the right on a dissapearing line of holds to join Pop or Drop at the arete and top out the same.
The tallish right arete as you look at the Fortress boulder.  One of the best routes at the grade in the area.

Sit start on huge jug at the right end of large ledge at base of boulder (just to the left of the big crack running up the boulder). Left hand on a sloping rail, right hand sidepull. Traverse left along the ledge till it ends then up to the topout. Good finger locks along the way.
content.protection: Spotter, pad.  Couple pads would be better.
content.location: Large ledge that runs along base of Fortress boulder on climbers left when looking uphill at boulder.  Well marked with chalk on the hand holds.

content.description: Sit start at base of arete.  Climb straight up arete using any holds on both sides.
content.location: It is to the right of Meat and Potatoes.  Start hold seems to be a flake on left side of arete.

content.description: Large boulder in the center of Middle Earth.  Can be identified by large ledge that runs climbers left along the base when facing up hill.  There is a nice finger crack that runs up this face above the ledge.  The ledge itself has a good problem and is usually coated with chalk.
